â
'''Oscar Grant Plaza''' is a historic location in the heart of downtown Oakland, California. The plaza is also known as "City Hall Park", "City Hall Plaza" or "Frank H. Ogawa Plaza". In 2011, the plaza became the site for the main encampment of the [[Occupy Oakland]] movement, which renamed the plaza in memory of [[Oscar Grant]], who was shot and killed by Oakland police in 2009.
+
'''Oscar Grant Plaza''' is a historic location in the heart of downtown Oakland, California. The plaza is also known as "City Hall Park", "City Hall Plaza", "Frank H. Ogawa Plaza".<ref>Also "City Hall Park-Plaza", "Ogawa-Grant Plaza"[http://www.reproductivejusticeblog.org/2011/11/memory-is-solidarity-ogawa-grant-plaza.html], etc</ref> In 2011, the plaza became the site for the main encampment of the [[Occupy Oakland]] movement, which renamed the plaza in memory of [[Oscar Grant]], who was shot and killed by Oakland police in 2009.
